News.Title: Tata Technologies' WATTSync Ready for Battery Aadhaar
News.Summary: Tata Technologies announces WATTSync platform's readiness for India's Battery Aadhaar ecosystem, supporting 21-character BPAN generation and compliance with global battery passport standards.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Grants 30,761 Employee Stock Options
News.Summary: Tata Technologies' Nomination and Remuneration Committee approved grant of 30,761 Performance Stock Options to eligible employees under Share Based Long Term Incentive Scheme 2022 with exercise price of ₹2 per option.

News.Title: Tata Technologies seeks shareholder approval for director
News.Summary: Tata Technologies Limited has issued a postal ballot notice seeking shareholder approval for the appointment of Mr. Dhiman Gupta as Non-Executive Non-Independent Director, with e-voting scheduled from January 29 to February 27, 2026.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Falls 2.02% Among Top Midcap Losers
News.Summary: Tata Technologies shares declined 2.02% to Rs 644.25, ranking among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150. Company announced InnoVent 2026 winners and shows mixed quarterly performance with Dec 2025 net loss.

News.Title: Tata Technologies CEO Expects Strong FY26 Growth
News.Summary: Tata Technologies anticipates double-digit organic growth in FY26 as automotive customers resume investments despite global uncertainty. Q3 revenue rose 3.67% to Rs 1,365.73 crore.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Announces InnoVent 2026 Winners
News.Summary: Tata Technologies concludes its 3rd InnoVent hackathon with 10,247 participants from 404 colleges. Top teams win ₹4.50 lakh in prizes, all 42 finalists receive career opportunities.

News.Title: Motilal Oswal cuts Tata Technologies target to ₹550
News.Summary: Brokerage maintains 'Sell' rating on Tata Technologies despite 2.3% QoQ revenue growth, citing premium valuations at 33x forward P/E and margin compression concerns.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Gets Hold Rating with ₹660 Target
News.Summary: Prabhudas Lilladher maintains Hold rating on Tata Technologies with target price of ₹660, citing revenue outperformance and aerospace growth prospects despite auto sector challenges.

News.Title: Tata Tech Eyes $40M Aerospace Revenue by FY26
News.Summary: Tata Technologies announces ES-TEC acquisition will boost FY27 growth, while aerospace sector revenue is projected to reach nearly $40 million by FY26, marking significant expansion in key business segments.

News.Title: Tata Tech Eyes 10%+ Q4 Growth, Double-Digit Target
News.Summary: Tata Technologies expects over 10% revenue growth in Q4 with EBITDA margins surpassing Q2 levels. Company targets double-digit organic growth by FY27 as per recent concall updates.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Q3 Net Profit Drops 96% to ₹66 Crores
News.Summary: Tata Technologies reported a significant decline in Q3 net profit to ₹66 crores from ₹1,690 crores year-on-year, despite revenue growth of 3.48% to ₹13,660 crores.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Updates Key Personnel Authorization
News.Summary: Tata Technologies Limited announces Board approval for Key Managerial Personnel changes to determine materiality of events under SEBI regulations, designating CEO Warren Harris and CFO Uttam Gujrati.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Board Changes: New Director Appointed
News.Summary: Tata Technologies announces key board changes with Dhiman Gupta's appointment as Non-Executive Director and resignations of Balaje Rajan and Company Secretary Vikrant Gandhe effective January 16, 2026.

News.Title: Tata Technologies announces board changes
News.Summary: Tata Technologies appoints Dhiman Gupta as Non-Executive Director while Balaje Rajan and Vikrant Gandhe resign from their positions effective January 16, 2026.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Board Changes: New Director Appointed
News.Summary: Tata Technologies appoints Dhiman Gupta as Non-Executive Director while Balaje Rajan resigns from the Board and Company Secretary Vikrant Gandhe steps down due to personal reasons.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Q3 Results: Net profit jumps to ₹616 cr
News.Summary: Tata Technologies reported Q3 net profit of ₹616 crore, up sharply from ₹165.5 crore QoQ, with revenue rising 3.3% to ₹1,366 crore despite margin pressures.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Q3FY26: Revenue up 3.2% QoQ to ₹13,657 cr
News.Summary: Tata Technologies reported 3.2% QoQ growth in operating revenues to ₹13,657 million for Q3FY26. Services segment revenues grew 4.7% QoQ to ₹10,602 million with EBITDA margin at 14.1%.

News.Title: Tata Tech Q3 EBITDA Falls 19% YoY to ₹1.9B Rupees
News.Summary: Tata Technologies Q3 EBITDA declined to ₹1.9 billion from ₹2.34 billion YoY, with EBITDA margin contracting to 14.13% from 17.77% due to Labour Code impact and operational challenges.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Q3 Profit Crashes 96% to ₹7 Crore
News.Summary: Tata Technologies reported a massive 96% YoY decline in Q3 net profit to ₹6.60 crore from ₹169 crore, despite 4% revenue growth to ₹1,366 crore during the quarter.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Allots 20,751 Equity Shares Under ESOP
News.Summary: Tata Technologies Limited has allotted 20,751 equity shares under its employee stock option scheme, increasing the company's paid-up share capital to ₹81,15,28,710 divided into 40,57,64,355 equity shares.

News.Title: Tata Elxsi Clarifies Volume Movement to BSE
News.Summary: Tata Elxsi responds to BSE inquiry on trading volume surge, confirms no undisclosed material events affecting stock price movements as of January 8, 2026.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Board Meet on Jan 16 for Q3FY26 Results
News.Summary: Tata Technologies Limited has scheduled a Board meeting on January 16, 2026 to consider Q3FY26 unaudited financial results for quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Receives GST Demand of INR 1.77 Crore Plus Penalty for Input Tax Credit Rejection
News.Summary: Tata Technologies received a GST order demanding tax of INR 1,77,20,025 plus interest and equal penalty amount for alleged wrongful input tax credit availment under CGST Act 2017. The company states there is no material impact on financials or operations and plans to file an appeal against the order.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Appoints Uttam Gujrati as CFO Following Savitha Balachandran's Resignation
News.Summary: Tata Technologies announced the resignation of CFO Savitha Balachandran effective December 30, 2025, to pursue career opportunities outside the Tata group, and appointed Uttam Gujrati as the new CFO from December 31, 2025. The transition involves a seasoned finance leader with over 20 years of experience taking charge at a pivotal stage for the global product engineering and digital services company, with management ensuring seamless continuity of financial operations.

News.Title: Tata Tech Completes €75 Million Acquisition of Es-tec GmbH
News.Summary: Tata Tech has completed the acquisition of Es-tec GmbH in a deal valued at €75 million with performance milestones included. The acquisition expands Tata Tech's operations and capabilities through the integration of Es-tec GmbH's business.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Board Approves USD 60 Million Corporate Guarantee for Singapore Subsidiary
News.Summary: Tata Technologies' Board of Directors approved issuance of a USD 60 million corporate guarantee in favor of MUFG Bank, Ltd., Singapore to secure a term loan facility for its wholly owned subsidiary Tata Technologies Pte Ltd, Singapore. The guarantee will be valid for 5 years or until full loan repayment and will be treated as a contingent liability for the company with no current impact on operations.

News.Title: Tata Technologies to Increase Local US Hiring Amid Immigration Policy Changes
News.Summary: Tata Technologies plans to hire more local nationals in the United States as the company responds to immigration policy changes under Donald Trump's administration. The US plans to charge businesses higher fees for H-1B visas, which are widely used by tech companies. CEO Warren Harris stated the company will recruit more local nationals in response to visa legislation changes. Tata Technologies provides engineering services to automotive, aerospace and heavy machinery companies across two dozen countries, with over 12,000 employees globally. North America represents about 20% of the company's $587.97 million revenue in 2024-2025. The company already employs over 70% local nationals in China, Sweden, the UK and US. Harris remains optimistic about the US market, expecting growth in 6-9 months as customers adapt to the new tariff regime. The company also plans targeted acquisitions following its $87.47 million purchase of German firm ES-Tec Group and reported a 5% rise in quarterly profit.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Reports 6.4% Sequential Revenue Growth in Q2 FY26, Signs Definitive Agreement to Acquire ES-TEC
News.Summary: Tata Technologies delivered sequential revenue growth of 6.4% to Rs. 1,323 crores in Q2 FY26, with services business growing 5.1% to Rs. 1,013 crores. The company reported normalized EBITDA margin of 16.4% after adjusting for cyber incident-related expenses of over Rs. 10 crores. Aerospace and Industrial Heavy Machinery segments delivered 14% sequential revenue growth in US dollar terms, while automotive vertical recorded 0.5% sequential increase. The company closed three large deals during the quarter, including engagements with a Tier 1 automotive supplier, a Scandinavian OEM for heads-up display development, and the first direct deal with a German OEM. Tata Technologies signed a definitive agreement to acquire ES-TEC, which provides access to Volkswagen as a key customer and adds over 300 engineers with expertise in ADAS, Connected Driving, and Embedded Software. The BMW joint venture scaled to over 1,000 employees. Management expects some moderation in Q3 due to seasonal factors and temporary headwinds including JLR's IT system restoration, followed by recovery in Q4. DSO increased to 109 days from 87 days in the previous quarter, while net cash position stood at $123 million. Total headcount remained stable at 12,402 employees with attrition rate at 15.1%.

News.Title: Tata Tech Anticipates Q4 FY26 Recovery Despite Q3 Growth Challenges
News.Summary: Tata Tech expects recovery in Q4 FY26 driven by recent contracts and rising demand. The company anticipates slower growth and margin pressure in Q3 FY26 due to salary increases and temporary customer challenges. Tata Tech does not provide detailed revenue or earnings forecasts.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Anticipates Multi-Year Growth from EV and Aerospace Programs
News.Summary: Tata Technologies expects multi-year growth visibility driven by global electric vehicle and aerospace programs. The company anticipates margin expansion through digital engineering and software-defined vehicle platforms.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Partners with Synopsys to Accelerate Software-Defined Vehicle Development
News.Summary: Tata Technologies announced a strategic collaboration with Synopsys to accelerate software-defined vehicle (SDV) innovation. The partnership combines Tata Technologies' vehicle engineering expertise with Synopsys' virtualization solutions for electronics digital twins deployment. The companies completed a pilot engagement with a European luxury OEM, delivering a next-generation E/E architecture migration blueprint. Additional pilot programs are underway with major OEMs in North America, Europe, and India. The collaboration spans major SDV domains including ADAS, powertrain, chassis, body, central compute, gateways, infotainment, connectivity, and electrification. Key focus areas include virtual prototypes development, simulation models, electronics digital twins for early software bring-up, performance and safety analysis tools, and embedded systems solutions aligned with ISO 26262 and ASPICE standards.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Reports Q2 FY26 Results with Consolidated Revenue of ₹1,323 Crore
News.Summary: Tata Technologies Limited announced its quarterly results for the quarter ended September 30, 2025. The company reported consolidated revenue from operations of ₹1,323.33 crore for the quarter, compared to ₹1,296.45 crore in the same quarter last year. Consolidated profit after tax stood at ₹165.50 crore versus ₹157.41 crore in the previous year quarter. For the half-year period, consolidated revenue reached ₹2,567.62 crore with profit after tax of ₹335.78 crore. The company operates through two segments: Services (₹1,012.82 crore revenue) and Technology Solutions (₹310.51 crore revenue) for the quarter. During the half-year, the company paid dividends totaling ₹11.70 per share, resulting in a cash outflow of ₹474.63 crore. The company has entered into an agreement to acquire Es-Tee GmbH, Germany for up to €75 million, expected to close by December 31, 2025. Additionally, following Tata Motors' demerger approval, Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles Ltd will become the holding company of Tata Technologies effective October 1, 2025.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Shares Rise 3% on €75 Million German Acquisition
News.Summary: Tata Technologies' shares gained 2.7% to Rs 721 following the announcement of its acquisition of Germany's ES-Tec Group for €75 million in cash. The transaction is expected to close by December 31, 2025, with payments spread over two years including performance-linked components. The acquisition aims to strengthen Tata Technologies' engineering and R&D capabilities in next-generation mobility technologies, particularly in advanced driver-assistance systems, connected driving, and digital engineering. ES-Tec's German presence provides access to automotive engineering talent and OEM accounts. The deal is expected to be earnings accretive from the first full year after completion. In quarterly results, Tata Technologies reported consolidated net profit growth of 5% to Rs 170 crore, while revenue from operations declined 2% to Rs 1,244 crore. The stock has declined 21% in 2025 and remains 50% below its record high of Rs 1,400.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Acquires German Automotive Engineering Firm ES-Tec Group for €75 Million
News.Summary: Tata Technologies has signed a definitive agreement to acquire 100% equity shares of ES-Tec GmbH and its subsidiaries through its wholly owned subsidiary Tata Technologies Pte. Limited. The total cash consideration is €75 million, including performance-based earn-outs to be paid over two years. ES-Tec Group, established in 2006 and headquartered in Wolfsburg, Germany, specializes in automotive engineering services with expertise in ADAS, Connected Driving, and Digital Engineering. The company generated revenues of €36 million in 2024 and employs over 300 professionals. ES-Tec's revenue grew from €24.7 million in 2022 to €30.6 million in 2023 and €36.1 million in 2024. The acquisition aims to enhance Tata Technologies' engineering research and development capabilities, strengthen its European presence, and expand its talent pool. The transaction requires anti-trust filings in Germany and Morocco and is expected to complete by December 31, 2026. The deal is projected to be EPS accretive from the first full year of operations.

News.Title: Tata Technologies: Shares Rally 25% on Q1 Results
News.Summary: Tata Technologies shares have risen 25% from April lows, trading near Rs 740. Q1 FY26 results show a 5% increase in net profit to Rs 170 crore, despite a 2% decline in revenue to Rs 1,244 crore.

News.Title: Tata Technologies: CEO Optimistic Despite Revenue Decline
News.Summary: Tata Technologies CEO Warren Harris expresses confidence in a strong second half of the year, despite two consecutive quarters of revenue decline and reduced profitability. Harris cites a robust order book as the basis for his optimism.

News.Title: Tata Technologies: Analysts Maintain Cautious Stance Despite Q1 Results
News.Summary: Tata Technologies reported Q1 results with revenue decline lower than expected but margins below estimates. 70% of analysts tracking the stock have a 'sell' rating. JPMorgan, Goldman Sachs, and Citi maintain 'sell' or 'underweight' ratings, citing weakness in services segment. Management expects sequential pickup in Q2 due to improved customer engagement and new deal wins.

News.Title: Tata Tech Anticipates Recovery and Growth in FY26
News.Summary: Tata Tech expects a recovery in Q2 and a stronger performance in the second half of FY26. The company aims for double-digit growth in FY26, with management planning to reassess this target after Q2 results.

News.Title: Tata Technologies: Q1 Profit Up 5% YoY, Revenue Dips 2%
News.Summary: Tata Technologies reported a 5% YoY increase in Q1FY26 consolidated net profit to Rs 170 crore, while revenue declined 2% to Rs 1,244 crore. EBITDA margin stood at 16.1%, and net profit margin improved to 13.7%. The company secured six strategic wins and expects a stronger second half of FY26.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Reports Q1 Financial Results
News.Summary: Tata Technologies has released its Q1 financial results. The company reported a consolidated net profit of 1.7 billion rupees, up from 1.62 billion rupees in the same quarter last year. Revenue for Q1 was 12.44 billion rupees, down from 12.69 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA for the quarter stood at 2 billion rupees, compared to 2.3 billion rupees in the previous year. The EBITDA margin decreased to 16.08% from 18.28% year-over-year.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Limited: Q1 FY26 Revenue Dips, Profitability Improves
News.Summary: Tata Technologies reported Q1 FY26 revenue of ₹1,244.3 crore, down 3.2% QoQ. Net income rose 5.1% YoY to ₹170.3 crore. The company secured six strategic wins, including partnerships with major automotive and aviation clients. Volvo Cars selected Tata Technologies as a strategic supplier.

News.Title: Tata Technologies: Q1 Profit Dips 10% but Beats Estimates
News.Summary: Tata Technologies reported a 10% sequential fall in Q1 FY2025 consolidated net profit to Rs 170 crore, surpassing analyst expectations of Rs 157 crore. Revenue from operations increased 3.3% to Rs 1,244 crore. EBIT decreased 17% to Rs 169 crore, with margins contracting to 13.6% from 15.8% in the previous quarter.

News.Title: Tata Technologies MD Optimistic About Future Performance
News.Summary: The Managing Director of Tata Technologies has expressed confidence in the company's recovery for the second quarter. Additionally, the MD anticipates a strong performance in the second half of FY26.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Reports Mixed Q1 Results
News.Summary: Tata Technologies has reported its Q1 financial results. The company's EBITDA decreased to 2 billion rupees from 2.3 billion rupees year-over-year. The EBITDA margin also declined to 16.08% from 18.28% in the same period last year. However, consolidated net profit increased to 1.7 billion rupees from 1.62 billion rupees year-over-year. Revenue for Q1 decreased to 12.44 billion rupees from 12.69 billion rupees in the previous year.

News.Title: Tata Technologies: Q1 Results Expected Today Amid 50% Share Price Drop
News.Summary: Tata Technologies will announce Q1 FY26 results today. Shares are trading at Rs 700, down 50% from their peak of Rs 1,400 at listing in November 2023. The stock is below key moving averages, indicating a bearish trend. Analysts suggest a potential further decline to Rs 650 if it breaks below the current consolidation range of Rs 695-720.

News.Title: Tata Technologies: Shares Dip Ahead of Q1 Results Announcement
News.Summary: Tata Technologies shares fell nearly 1% in early trade on Monday as investors turned cautious before Q1 earnings release. Analysts expect net profit of Rs 157 crore and revenue of Rs 1,208.39 crore, with EBIT of Rs 171 crore and operating margins of 14.15%. These figures indicate a sequential decline from Q4 FY25.

News.Title: Tata Technologies Ltd: Q1 FY2026 Results Announcement and Earnings Call Scheduled
News.Summary: Tata Technologies Ltd. will announce Q1 FY2026 results on July 14, 2025. Board meeting and investor call scheduled for the same day. Trading window closed from June 24 until 48 hours post-results declaration.

News.Title: Tata Technologies: Partners with Emerson for Advanced Mobility Testing Solutions
News.Summary: Tata Technologies has partnered with US-based Emerson to develop integrated testing and validation solutions for global OEMs in automotive, aerospace, and commercial vehicle sectors. The collaboration aims to accelerate development cycles and reduce costs for connected, electric, and autonomous vehicles.

News.Title: Tata Technologies: BoFA Securities Downgrades Stock to 'Neutral'
News.Summary: BoFA Securities downgraded Tata Technologies to 'Neutral' due to expected 6.5% QoQ revenue decline in Q1. Price objective maintained at ₹730. Company aims for double-digit growth this fiscal year despite muted Q1. Stock trading at ₹709.85, down 20% in 2025.

News.Title: Tata Technologies: Soft Q1 FY26 Expected, Strong Recovery Projected for Q2
News.Summary: Tata Technologies anticipates a soft Q1 FY26 but projects a strong recovery in Q2. CEO Warren Harris attributes current investment delays to global uncertainties but expects heavy spending to return. The company sees the automotive industry's future as electric and software-driven. Despite revenue challenges, Tata Technologies maintains focus on operational efficiency and margin protection.
